thread.title: Anne Frank Center director blames Trump for anti-Semitism
thread.title_full: Anne Frank Center director blames Trump for anti-Semitism

title: Anne Frank Center director blames Trump for anti-Semitism

organizations.name: national museum of african american history and culture

text: show ad Anne Frank Center director blames Trump and his 'henchman' Steve Bannon for the 'cancer' of anti-Semitism currently in America: 'Our president is creating an incubator of hatred' The executive director of a human rights organization founded in Holocaust victim Anne Frank's name exploded on President Donald Trump today Said Trump is as a 'purveyor' of anti-Semitism and called on him to fire a senior White House aide accused on making insulting statements about Jews Steven Goldstein tore into the president and 'his henchman' Steve Bannon, Trump's chief strategist, whom he also referred to as 'a notorious anti-Semite' Bannon has denied that he slurred Jews and other charges of racism against him This morning the president denounced anti-Semistism in remarks at the National Museum of African American History and Culture in Washington, D.C. He said the threats to Jewish centers are 'horrible and are painful' and must stop Goldstein said his comments came too late and don't go far enough - 'His silence is why there is a cancer of anti-Semitism in the White House' Published: 22:52 GMT, 21 February 2017 | Updated: 03:36 GMT, 22 February 2017 485 shares
